name: libimobiledevice
description: Library to communicate with iOS devices natively

repo.name: libimobiledevice
repo.description: A cross-platform protocol library to communicate with iOS devices

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and feature description, but lacks practical usage examples and troubleshooting guidance beyond installation.
readme.top_issue: No quick start code examples showing how to actually use the library - only refers users to "look at the implementation of the included utilities"

injection_risks.description: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in debugserver_encode_string function due to lack of bounds checking on encoded_length
Use of string_concat function without proper null-termination checks

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in debugserver_encode_string function
Lack of input validation on user-provided arguments
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good coding practices.

common_complaints: WiFi connectivity detection failing (idevice_id not finding devices)
Backup failures with cryptic error messages
Symbol lookup and linking errors during installation
Build system issues (autogen.sh python version detection)
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor: multiple long-standing unresolved WiFi detection issues (dating back to 2023), slow maintainer response, recent build failures, and no positive feedback or active issue resolution visible.

red_flags: dismissal of issues as 'not a bug'
communication.summary: The maintainer provides generally helpful and technically detailed responses, but can be abrupt or dismissive at times, which may deter new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from November 2025
813 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests stagnation
maintenance.summary: libimobiledevice appears abandoned with no maintenance activity in the past 6 months and a large backlog of unaddressed issues.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is thorough but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
concerns: Docs: Lack of a concise quick start guide to help new users get started with the library.
Community: compatibility problems with newer iOS versions
Communication: dismissal of issues as 'not a bug'
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in debugserver_encode_string function
Security: Lack of input validation on user-provided arguments
